availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, attorney. Green County, Kentucky, native. Son of John Barret and Mary Walker Wood Barret. Married to Maria Elizabeth Goodloe Barret on July 8, 1846. Father of William Goodloe Barret, Henry Owsley Barret, Mary Walker Barret, John Barret, William Goodloe Barret, Maria Elizabeth Barret. Attorney in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Attorney in Louisville in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860.
